snippet: A trip to the observatory, which opens to the public on May 29, costs $32 per person, and it offers far wider panoramas than that of the old observatory.
abstract: Legends Hospitality, preparing to open observatory near top of 1 World Trade Center, gives preview of site to reporters from several news organizations; will open to public in late May 2015, charging $32 for admission; observatory features large windows and impressive panorama, and is expected to bring in over $875 million during 15-year contract period.
lead_paragraph: A trip to the observatory, which opens to the public on May 29, costs $32 per person, and it offers far wider panoramas than that of the old observatory.

headline.main: Early Views From New World Trade Center Observatory
headline.print_headline: The View From Manhattan’s New Summit
